summary: This is an email chain from June 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing the upcoming FOIA disclosure related to the Epstein case, specifically concerning individuals named Noel and Thomas. The emails coordinate internal notifications, a requested extension for production, and discussions about briefing the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) and possibly other parties.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Individual whose records are part of the FOIA production being discussed. Likely connected to the Epstein case, possibly a staff member or associate.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Individual whose records are part of the FOIA production being discussed. Likely connected to the Epstein case, possibly a staff member or associate.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same FOIA disclosure and are referenced together in the context of their deferred prosecution agreements and interviews.

events.title: FOIA Production Deadline
events.description: Extended deadline for the U.S. Attorney's Office to produce documents in response to a FOIA request related to Noel and Thomas in the Epstein case.

events.title: Call with The Times
events.description: SDNY staff scheduled a call with The New York Times to discuss a requested extension for the FOIA production deadline.

events.title: Internal Coordination on FOIA
events.description: Internal emails among SDNY staff discussing notification procedures for BOP and other constituencies regarding the upcoming FOIA release.

keyFacts: The document discusses an upcoming FOIA disclosure related to individuals named Noel and Thomas in the Epstein case.
The U.S. Attorney's Office sought and obtained a one-week extension for the FOIA production, moving the deadline to July 2, 2021.
Internal coordination involved notifying the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) hierarchy, including the Chief of Public Affairs and potentially the Chief of Staff in the Director's Office.
The emails reference that Noel and Thomas had completed interviews as part of their deferred prosecution agreements, which needed to be reviewed before the FOIA production.
There was consideration about whether to notify Epstein's estate or Noel/Thomas's counsel about the FOIA release, but the decision appears to have been against it.
